page.title: 14THE ASHWELL SHOW
page.content: The Ashwell show is organised by a committee of people from Ashwell and the surrounding villages. The members are local businessmen doctors and farmers about fifteen in all. They meet about once a month to plan the show. It is always held on August Bank Holiday Monday. It is such a large undertaking that anything up to a hundred and fifty helpers spend the previous two days getting the fields ready. The attendance over the last two years has been in the region of six to seven thousand and the profit between five and six thousand pounds.The profits are distributed on the basis of discussions held by the committee in the Autumn. Local ammenities and like the village hall, museum and church receive donations as do organisations like the P.T.A.who help on the day.
